marketNews.title: AKRA 1Q25: Net Profit -5% YoY, In Line with Expectations
marketNews.content:
AKR Corporindo (AKRA) recorded a net profit of IDR 565 billion in 1Q25, down 5% year-over-year (YoY) and down 25% quarter-over-quarter (QoQ), representing 23% of the 2025 consensus estimate and about 22-24% of management’s 2025 guidance. No JIIPE land sale occurred in 1Q25, but management indicated a potential land-sale volume of 20-45 ha for 2Q25.

1. **PBT of the Trading and Distribution segment grew +16% YoY** – The profit-before-tax (PBT) from the ‘trading and distribution’ segment, which contributes roughly 65-75% of total PBT, recovered with a +16% YoY increase in 1Q25. Gross profit for this segment also rose +17% YoY, surpassing the 2025 guidance of +5-7% YoY. The improvement was mainly driven by a low-base effect in 1Q24 caused by RKAB permit issues for mining-sector customers.

Looking ahead, AKRA will keep the gross-profit guidance for the trading and distribution segment at +5-7% YoY for 2025, given potential weakening of fuel demand due to softening commodity prices. To offset this, management will optimise revenue from the retail (bp AKR) segment and the chemical raw-material trading segment.

2. **No JIIPE land sale in 1Q25, but 20-45 ha expected in 2Q25** – Although no JIIPE land was sold in 1Q25, AKRA confirmed a sale of 20 ha to Golden Elephant in 2Q25, which will be reflected in the financial statements. This 20 ha sale already exceeds the 1H24 level of 18.1 ha. In addition, AKRA expects an additional 20-25 ha sale in 2Q25. If realised, total JIIPE land sales in 1H25 could reach 40-45 ha, i.e., 40-45% of the 2025 target of 100 ha.

During 1Q25, the ‘industrial park’ segment still recorded profit from recurring income such as land rent and electricity/utilities. Management expects recurring income to rise further in coming quarters, driven by higher utilisation at the Xinyi Glass plant and the Freeport copper smelter, which is targeted to resume operations in June 2025.

Management explained that the US-China trade war escalation creates opportunities, as some Chinese firms will expand abroad to avoid US tariffs.

marketNews.title: China Considers Suspending 125% Tariff on Some US Imports
marketNews.content: The Bloomberg report on Friday, 25 April 2025 stated that the Chinese government is considering suspending the 125% tariff on several US imports—including medical equipment, certain industrial chemicals such as ethane, and aircraft leasing—to ease the burden on industries still dependent on US products. Previously, the United States had suspended a 145% tariff on smartphones, computers and other popular electronic goods. Bloomberg noted that investors are awaiting whether the two sides will reduce their respective tariffs, although the outlook appears stalled.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Prioritises National Interest in US Tariff Talks
marketNews.content: Indonesia’s Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said on Friday, 25 April that the government will prioritize national interest in tariff negotiations with the United States, adding that Indonesia seeks a “fair and honest” trade relationship. He did not disclose specific negotiation details. Previously, the government proposed increasing US imports to $19 billion in the negotiation proposal to close the US trade deficit. Indonesia recorded a US trade surplus of $16.8 billion in 2024.

marketNews.title: World Bank and IMF Trim Indonesia 2025 Growth Forecasts to 4.7% YoY
marketNews.content: The World Bank cut its 2025 Indonesia growth outlook to +4.7% YoY, down from the October 2024 projection of +5.1% YoY. The Bank noted the revision reflects both regional growth prospects and the impact of global policy uncertainty. The IMF also lowered its 2025 Indonesia growth forecast from +5.1% to +4.7% YoY this week.

marketNews.title: CATL Investment in Indonesian Battery Project Scaled Down
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of Investment and Downstream, Nurul Ichwan, acknowledged a downsizing of Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. (CATL) investment in the joint battery-cell project with Industry Battery Corporation, reducing the investment to US$417 million from the original US$1.18 billion after CATL saw weaker electric-vehicle demand. Earlier, a consortium led by LG withdrew from another EV-battery supply chain project in Indonesia for similar reasons.

marketNews.title: Government Reviews Funding Schemes for Village-Cooperative Program
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani said on Thursday, 24 April that the government is reviewing three financing schemes for the village-cooperative program that needs IDR 400 trillion. The three schemes are public-fund financing, loans from state-owned banks, or direct transfers to regions. The statement signals that state-owned banks may not yet be involved, although the Coordinating Minister for Food, Zulkifli Hasan, said in early March 2025 that state banks would be involved.

marketNews.title: Indonesia’s Broad-Money (M2) Growth Slows to 6.1% YoY in March 2025
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that broad-money (M2) growth slowed to +6.1% YoY in March 2025, reaching IDR 9,436.4 trillion (February 2025: +6.2% YoY). The slowdown was driven by M1 growth of +7.1% YoY and quasi-money growth of +3% YoY.

marketNews.title: AP & RGE Join Bid for Kimberly-Clark’s $4 Billion International Tissue Unit
marketNews.content: Asia Pulp & Paper Co., Royal Golden Eagle and Suzano SA are the final bidders for Kimberly-Clark’s $4 billion international tissue business, according to a Reuters report on Thursday, 24 April. The three firms are conducting due diligence and are expected to submit a bid by mid-May 2025. The target business has an EBITDA of about $500 million.

marketNews.title: TLDN Announces 2024 Dividend of IDR 31 per Share
marketNews.content: Teladan Prima Agro (TLDN) will distribute a 2024 dividend of approximately IDR 401.3 billion, or IDR 31 per share, representing a 49% dividend payout ratio and an implied dividend yield of 5.3% as of Friday, 25 April. The cum-date is 6 May 2025 on the regular and negotiation markets, with payment on 15 May 2025.

marketNews.title: Hillcon Equity Management Reduces Stake in HILL to 57.13%
marketNews.content: Hillcon Equity Management sold 49.7 million HILL shares at IDR 312 per share on 21 April 2025, valuing the transaction at IDR 15.5 billion. After the sale, PT Hillcon Equity Management’s ownership fell from 57.47% to 57.13%.

marketNews.title: Top Gainer
marketNews.content: Top Gainer: INET, BTPS, UNVR, RAJA – gains of +19.57%, +17.53%, +17.06%, +12.00% respectively.

marketNews.title: Top Loser
marketNews.content: Top Loser: SMIL, KPIG, PGAS, BDKR – declines of -14.77%, -3.94%, -2.54%, -2.33% respectively.

tickerNews.title: AKRA 1Q25 Net Profit –5% YoY
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo (AKRA) posted a net profit of IDR 565 billion in 1Q25, down 5% YoY and down 25% QoQ, equal to 23% of the 2025 consensus estimate and about 22-24% of management’s 2025 guidance. No JIIPE land sale occurred in 1Q25; management indicated a potential 20-45 ha land sale in 2Q25.

tickerNews.title: BTPS 1Q25 Net Profit +18% YoY, Beats Consensus
tickerNews.content: Bank BTPN Syariah (BTPS) reported a net profit of IDR 311 billion in 1Q25 (+18% YoY, +6.9% QoQ), beating the ~27% 2025 consensus estimate. The result was supported by a fall in provision expenses to IDR 218 billion (-43% YoY, -13% QoQ). NPF improved to 3.4% from 3.6% in 3Q24 and 3.7% in 4Q24, though still above the 1Q24 level of 3%. Revenue after distribution fell to IDR 1.17 trillion (-5.8% YoY, -2.9% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: UNTR 1Q25 Dividend and Equipment Sales Update
tickerNews.content: United Tractors (UNTR) shareholders approved a 2024 dividend of about IDR 1.484 trillion (40% payout), implying a final dividend of IDR 1,484 per share and a 6.4% yield as of 25 April. Previously, UNTR paid an interim dividend of IDR 667 per share in August 2024. In a separate update, UNTR reported sales of 414 Komatsu units in March 2025 (-4.8% MoM, +37.5% YoY), bringing 1Q25 equipment sales to 1,385 units (+23% YoY), 30% of the 2025 target, with a 24% market share (vs. 26% in 2M25, 29% in 1Q24). tickerNews.title: CMRY 1Q25 Net Profit +24% YoY
tickerNews.content: Cisarua Mountain Dairy (CMRY) posted a net profit of IDR 480 billion in 1Q25 (+24% YoY, +32% QoQ), slightly above the ~28% 2025 consensus estimate. Net profit growth was driven by a 12% YoY increase in revenue and a 2% QoQ rise, while operating margin rose to 20.7% (up 100 bps YoY, +820 bps QoQ). Gross profit margin was flat year-on-year (-30 bps) but fell 150 bps QoQ. Financial income contributed IDR 91 billion (up from 1Q24 57 billion, 4Q 86 billion).
